entry.title: Russian Forces Closer to Taking Mariupol
entry.content: The Russian Defense Ministry said the urban areas of the besieged port city had been cleared of Ukrainian troops, with local military resistance isolated at a metallurgical plant in an industrial area.

entry.title: After More Than a Month of Fighting, Much of Mariupol Lies in Ruins
entry.content: The key Ukrainian port city has seen some of the fiercest urban warfare since the Russians invaded.

entry.title: Ukraine's Jews Celebrate Wartime Passover in Defiance of Russian Invasion
entry.content: U.S. charities helped organize communal Seder gatherings in war-torn regions and for Ukrainian refugees abroad.

entry.title: Shanghai's Lockdown Knocks Out E-Commerce, Leaving Group Buying and Bartering
entry.content: As grocery delivery is thrown into disarray, one neighbor gets three oranges in return for lending out his cat.

entry.title: At Least 150 Injured in Clashes at Jerusalem Holy Site
entry.content: Israeli police said young masked men used fireworks, stones and other heavy objects to attack security forces around Al Aqsa mosque.

entry.title: Venezuelans Flee Again,This Time to the U.S.
entry.content: Struggling in countries hard-hit by the pandemic, tens of thousands of displaced Venezuelans are on the moveÂ again, trekking to the U.S. in search of asylum and stability.

entry.title: 'I Lost James.' An American Dad Hunts for His 8-Year-Old in the Chaos of Afghanistan's Fall.
entry.content: James was separated from his family in the mob pushing to enter the Kabul airport before the Taliban takeover last summer. That left his father with a terrible choice.
